cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies possess a proboscis as a mouthpart.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject entity includes the object entity as a physical component or substructure.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The escaped criminal has a hook instead of a hand.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity includes the object entity as a physical or conceptual component.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity includes the object entity as a physical or conceptual component or substructure.
args.justification: Both relations express the same part–whole semantics (a subject possessing a physical component). They already share the same canonical_rel_name and rel_cls_group; the only discrepancy is in the wording of canonical_rel_desc. Normalizing to a single, general description improves schema consistency while covering both examples (a butterfly's proboscis and a criminal's hook hand) as physical or conceptual components.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity includes the object entity as a physical or conceptual component or substructure.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations express the same part–whole semantics (a subject possessing a physical component). They already share the same canonical_rel_name and rel_cls_group; the only discrepancy is in the wording of canonical_rel_desc. Normalizing to a single, general description improves schema consistency while covering both examples (a butterfly's proboscis and a criminal's hook hand) as physical or conceptual components.
